interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Agatha Christie's Marple, Series 1
Review Date: 2008/05/12
Store: Geraldine McEwan  (Actor),     Griff Rhys Jones  (Actor),     Andy Wilson  (Director),     Charles Palmer  (Director)    &                   1                  more   Rated:    Unrated    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Drama
Product Description: ['Product Description', 'Geraldine McEwan stars as the matronly detective in this new series of mysteries featuring all-new feature-length adaptations of Christie classics starring Joanna Lumley, Derek Jacobi, Tara Fitzgerald and Ian Richardson. Includes the Murder at the Vicarage (2004/94 min.), the Body in the Library (2004/94 min.), 4:50 from Paddington (2004/94 min.) and a Murder Is Announced (2005/94 min.). 4 episodes on 4 DVDs. Color/NR/fullscreen.', 'Amazon.com', 'Miss Marple is back, and what an invigorating, happy experience this quartet of British television productions is for both mystery fans and casual viewers. The luminous Geraldine McEwan (', 'Vanity Fair', "), following in the footsteps of Helen Hayes, Angela Lansbury, Margaret Rutherford, and others, essays Agatha Christie's aging, amateur sleuth as a discreet observer, knowing friend, and judicious dispenser of wisdom during murder investigations. But what really makes these crisp adaptations a delight is the endless parade of familiar actors playing those numerous suspects, baffled police, and innocent observers who routinely populate Christie's glossy, whodunit landscapes. It's hard not to be dazzled by supporting casts that include Tara Fitzgerald, Robert Powell, Simon Callow, Joanna Lumley, Ian Richardson, Jane Asher, Miriam Margolyes, Tim McInnerny, Herbert Lom, and Jenny Agutter, all nestled into gorgeous, post-World War II backdrops, usually in the English countryside.", 'This boxed set includes "The Murder at the Vicarage," based on Christie\'s 1930 book about the killing of one hugely unlikable Colonel Protheroe (Derek Jacobi) in Jane Marple\'s pretty home village of St. Mary Mead. Typically, there is no end of likely suspects, but what makes the investigation unusual is a pair of competing confessions from two illicit lovers (Jason Flemyng, Janet McTeer). Stephen Tompkinson (', 'Ballykissangel', ') is very good as a police inspector who slowly develops admiration for Miss Marple\'s keen mind. "The Body in the Library" finds Marple aiding the brassy Dolly Bantry (Lumley) after the latter finds the body of an unknown woman in her library. Callow is wonderful as another cop who initially underestimates the heroine\'s gifts. "A Murder Is Announced," in which a killing is advertised before it happens, and "4:50 from Paddington," about a murder without a body, round out the set with imaginative plots and memorable performances. Don\'t miss the special featurette in which McEwan and others talk about the endless appeal of Miss Marple.', '--Tom Keogh', 'Review', 'Lively scripting, crisp direction, and evocative design... Christie fans have a treat in store. --', 'The Hollywood Reporter', 'The episodes themselves are visually arresting, really lush and beautiful. --', 'Julia Buckley blog', 'See more']
Average Rating: 4.4
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Television/British Television, Television/Crime', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Box set, Closed-captioned, Color, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Contributor': "Tim Stern, Niamh Cusack, John Strickland, Kurtis O'Brien, Griff Rhys Jones, Pam Ferris, Geraldine McEwan, Kevin Elyot, Charlie Creed-Miles, Michael Landes, Stephen Churchett, Ben Daniels, Andy Wilson, Toby Marlow, Agatha Christie, David Warner, Charles Palmer, Stewart Harcourt, Ciarn McMenaminTim Stern, Niamh Cusack, John Strickland, Kurtis O'Brien, Griff Rhys Jones, Pam Ferris, Geraldine McEwan, Kevin Elyot, Charlie Creed-Miles, Michael Landes, Stephen Churchett, Ben Daniels, Andy Wilson, Toby Marlow, Agatha Christie, David Warner, Charles Palmer, Stewar…   See more", 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Stereo), Unqualified', 'Number Of Discs': '4', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.75 x 5.5 x 2.5 inches; 6.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '2228910', 'Director': 'Andy Wilson, Charles Palmer, John Strickland', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Box set, Closed-captioned, Color, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Run time': '6 hours and 16 minutes', 'Release date': 'January 1, 2016', 'Actors': 'Geraldine McEwan, Griff Rhys Jones, David Warner, Niamh Cusack, Ben Daniels', 'Studio': 'ACORN MEDIA', 'Writers': 'Agatha Christie, Kevin Elyot, Stephen Churchett, Stewart Harcourt', 'Number of discs': '4'}
Review Text: I have been a masterpiece / mystery theater fan for years, and find the Miss Marple series with Geraldine McEwan to be top notch.  Excellent actors, sumptious costumes, and beautiful settings make for  extremely entertaining viewing.  Geraldine McEwan is marvelous, and is much better than Joan Hicks ever was!  A perfectly lovely voice accompanies the very intelligent eyes!
Review Title: westonjm
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

McKenna, Sheila Allen, Tania Blunden, Mirella Sklavounou, Ben Kingsley, Helen Mirren, Scott Millaney, Nadim Sawalha, D… See more', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 44 minutes'} Fascinating movie about a betrail that occurs because of a message that was never received. Ben Kingsley is wonderful.

When will this movie be made available in DVD? pascali's world Johnny Mnemonic Keanu Reeves (Actor), Dolph Lundgren (Actor), Robert Longo (Director) & 0 more Rated: R Format: DVD Movies & TV, Science Fiction & Fantasy, Science Fiction, Futuristic ['Product Description', "Keanu Reeves is a space-age courier who's plugged in, turned on and buffed up to deliver the most important data of the 21st century, wet-wired directly into his brain! A rapid-fire roller coaster ofaction and high-impact imagery! Also starring Dolph Lundgren, Takeshi, Ice-T, Dina Meyer and Henry Rollins.", 'Amazon.com', 'You might be tempted to call it "Johnny Moronic" after you\'ve seen this illogical and derivative adaptation of William Gibson\'s cyberpunk short story (available in his book', 'Burning Chrome', '), which is all the more depressing since Gibson himself wrote the screenplay. First you have to ask yourself why valuable top-secret electronic data would be stored in the "wet-wired" brain of a human courier (played by Keanu Reeves), who then transports the data from China to New Jersey as part of his last, most dangerous assignment. Surely there are better ways to transmit sensitive information, but since this is really just a conventional thriller with near-future design and spiffy special effects, Gibson and New York artist Robert Longo (making his directorial debut) are more interested in surface gloss and cyberpunk atmosphere. On that level the movie\'s fairly engaging, and Japanese film star Takeshi Kitano makes a pretty good villain, tracking Reeves down for the information in his data-packed brain. The movie also boasts an eclectic gallery of supporting players including rapper Ice-T, performance artist and rocker Henry Rollins, beefcake actor Dolph Lundgren, and transcontinental oddball Udo Kier. They can\'t stop this trip through virtual reality from being botched up, but sci-fi fans will certainly enjoy the echo of Gibson\'s fiction that remains on the screen.', '--Jeff Shannon'] {'Genre': 'Action, Sci-Fi', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, Full Screen, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Ice-T, Robert Longo, Cinevisions, Takeshi, Don Carmody, Keanu Reeves, Dolph Lundgren, Dina Meyer', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround), French (Dolby Digital 2.0 Stereo), Spanish (Dolby Digital 2.0 Stereo)', 'Runtime': '2 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'R (Restricted)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.38 x 0.6 inches; 0.01 Ounces', 'Director': 'Robert Longo', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, Full Screen, NTSC', 'Run time': '2 minutes', 'Release date': 'November 25, 1997', 'Actors': 'Keanu Reeves, Dolph Lundgren, Takeshi, Ice-T, Dina Meyer', 'Dubbed': 'French', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish', 'Producers': 'Don Carmody', 'Studio': 'Sony Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Number of discs': '1'} This was a great film until the dolphin sequence appears. How could such a great beginning end up so poorly? Too much tuna in the writers diet, I suppose! dolphin nightmare! profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Media Preference:** The user continues to showcase a strong affinity for classic and art-house films, particularly from the UK, while also expanding their interest to include critically examined science fiction narratives. Their recent purchases indicate a pronounced appreciation for British television and mystery adaptations.
- **Format Preference:** The preference for physical media remains prominent, especially for VHS tapes, but they are increasingly embracing modern formats like DVD, reflecting a blend of nostalgia and contemporary tastes.
- **Quality Focus:** High-quality presentation and pristine condition are significant to the user, who seeks out well-produced content with appealing packaging.
- **Review Behavior:** They actively engage with products through detailed reviews, demonstrating enthusiasm for storytelling, notable performances, and strong production values. Their critiques remain discerning, as evidenced by their willingness to elevate works that surpass expectations in adaptation and performance.
- **Rating Trend:** The user maintains a high rating trend, indicating appreciation for storytelling, while also showcasing critical evaluations of recent acquisitions, reflecting a sophisticated taste.
- **Inquiry Interest:** Their curiosity about film availability across various formats persists, evidenced by ongoing engagement in discovering diverse technological advancements within the film and television landscape.

Overall, the user embodies the profile of a dedicated film and television enthusiast who values quality narratives, tangible formats, and artistic integrity, while broadening their horizons in alignment with personal interests.
